titleStmt.title: The Kings Maiesties speech on the 2 day of December 1641 to the honourable House of Parliament likewise a true relation of all those cruel rapes and murders which have lately beene committed by the papists in Ireland : with the names of severall marchants that were taken transporting ammunition to Ireland for the rise of the rebels.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: Still bloody newes from Ireland, p. [5] appears to be part of 259:E.199, no. 30 rather than 259:E.199, no. 31 -- Cf. BMC.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
